revised_title: Artificial Tannin: Comparative Analysis and Experimental Results
tldr: Charles Hatchett investigates the properties of an artificial substance that possesses the main characteristics of tannin. He conducts experiments to compare its resistance to nitric acid with other tanning substances and explores its behavior under various conditions. The artificial substance proves to be more indestructible than other tanning materials, but there are still differences in its resistance to nitric acid when compared to natural sources.
